title: Robust Inference for Multiple Predictive Regressions with an Application on Bond Risk Premia. (arXiv:2401.01064v1 [stat.ME])
abstract: We propose a robust hypothesis testing procedure for the predictability of multiple predictors that could be highly persistent. Our method improves the popular extended instrumental variable (IVX) testing (Phillips and Lee, 2013; Kostakis et al., 2015) in that, besides addressing the two bias effects found in Hosseinkouchack and Demetrescu (2021), we find and deal with the variance-enlargement effect. We show that two types of higher-order terms induce these distortion effects in the test statistic, leading to significant over-rejection for one-sided tests and tests in multiple predictive regressions. Our improved IVX-based test includes three steps to tackle all the issues above regarding finite sample bias and variance terms. Thus, the test statistics perform well in size control, while its power performance is comparable with the original IVX. translated_title: 多元预测回归的稳健推断及债券风险溢价应用
translated_abstract: 我们提出了一种稳健的假设检验程序，用于评估可能存在高持久性的多个预测变量的可预测性。我们的方法在改进了流行的扩展工具变量 (IVX) 检验 (Phillips和Lee, 2013; Kostakis等, 2015) 的基础上，不仅解决了Hosseinkouchack和Demetrescu (2021)中发现的两种偏差效应，还发现并处理了方差扩大效应。我们表明，两类高阶项导致了这些畸变效应的发生，从而在单边检验和多元预测回归中导致了显著的超级拒绝。我们改进的基于IVX的检验包括三个步骤，以解决有限样本偏差和方差项的所有问题。因此，这种改进的检验统计量在尺寸控制方面表现出色，而其功率性能与原始IVX相当。通过蒙特卡罗模拟和对债券风险溢价的经验研究，我们展示了该方法的有效性。
tldr: 本论文提出了一种稳健的假设检验程序，用于评估多个预测变量的可预测性。与现有方法相比，我们的方法能够解决偏差和方差扩大效应，并在有限样本偏差和方差项方面表现出色。通过模拟和实证研究，我们证明了该方法的有效性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a robust hypothesis testing procedure for evaluating the predictability of multiple predictors. Compared to existing methods, our approach addresses bias and variance enlargement effects, and performs well in terms of finite sample bias and variance terms. The effectiveness of the proposed method is demonstrated through simulations and an empirical study.
